article.headline: Loyola of Chicago 70, Detroit 64
article.story: DETROIT (AP) -- Blake Schilb scored 13 of his 21 points in the second half Wednesday to help Loyola stop Detroit 70-64 and end a five-game road losing streak. Trailing 34-29 at intermission, Detroit (5-12, 2-4 Horizon League) tied the game seven minutes into the second half. Loyola (12-7, 4-3) answered with field goals in its next four possessions and outscored the Titans 11-5 to give itself some breathing room. Schilb, who finished with six assists, made three 3-pointers during the run. Detroit cut the lead to 61-58 after Zach Everingham's three-point play with 5:50 to play, but managed just six more points the rest of the game. Brandon Cotton led the Titans with 22 points, 17 coming in the second half. Chris Hayes had 14 points for Detroit, which also got 10 points and 12 rebounds from Ryvon Coville. Leon Young came off the bench to score 14 points for Loyola. Everingham added eight assists.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
